gurmukhi: ins idn jpMq snkM snwq ]nhI qidp qws soBw inrwq ]muK cwr byd ik`ny ibcwr ]qij grb nyq nyqY aucwr ]81]
transliteration: Nis Din Japant Sanakan Sanaat|| Nahitadip Taas Sobhaa Niraat|| Moukh Chaar Bed Kinne Bichaar|| Taj(i) Gadab Net Netai Ouchaar||81||
translation: If Sanak, Sunandan etc. remember Him continuously night and day, then also Hi Glory cannot be described; Brahma crated all the four Vedas, but on reflecting about Him, he also talks of Him as “Neti, Neti” (no this, not this.)81.

gurmukhi: iSv shMs brK lO jog kIn ]qij nyh gyh bnbws lIn ]bhu kIn joig qh bhu pRkwr ]nhI qidp qws lih skw pwr ]82]
transliteration: Shiv Sahans Barakh Lau Jog Keen|| Taj(i) Neh Geh Banbaas Leen|| Bahu Keen Joh(i) Tah Bahu Prakaar|| Nahitadip Taas Lah(i) Sakaa Paar||82||
translation: Shiva practiced Yoga for thousands of years; he left his home and all attachment and resided in the forest; he also practiced Yoga in various ways, but still he could not know His end.82.

gurmukhi: ijh eyk rUp AnkM pRkwS ]AibXkq qyj insidn audws ]Awsn Afol mihmw ABMg ]AnBv pRkwS soBw surMg ]83]
transliteration: Jih Ek Roop Ankan Prakaadh|| Abiyakat Tej Nisdin Udaas|| Aasan Adol Mahimaa Abhan|| Anbhav Prakaadh Sobhaa Suran||83||
translation: Many worlds are manifested from His one form and the Lustre of that Lord, who remains unattached throughout night and day, cannot be described; His seat is permanent and He is praiseworthy, Lustrous and Glorrious.83.

gurmukhi: ijh S`qR eykY smwn ]AibXkq qyj mihmw mhwn ]ijh Awid AMiq eykY srUp ]suMdr surMg jg kir ArUp ]84]
transliteration: Jih Shattru Mitra Ekai Samaan|| Abiyakat Tej Mahimaa Mahaan|| Jih Aadh Ant Ekai Daroop|| Soundar Suran Jag Kar(i)daroop||84||
translation: The enemies and friends are alike for Him and His invisible Lustre and Praise are Supreme; He has the same form in the beginning and at the end and He is the Creator of this fascinating world.84.

gurmukhi: ijh rwg rMg nhI rUp ryK ]nhI nwm Twm AnBv AByK ]Awjwn bwih AnBv pRkwS ]AwBw AnMq mihmw subws ]85]
transliteration: Jih Raag Ran Nahiroop Rekh|| Nahinaam Thaam Anbhav Abhekh|| Aajaan Baah(i) Anbhev Prakaadh|| Aabhaa Anant Mahimaa Soubaas||85||
translation: He has no form or line, no attachment or detachment; that Guiseless Lord had no special Name or Place; that Long-armed and omnipotent Lord is the manifestation of cognition and His Comeliness and Greatness are infinite.85.

gurmukhi: keI klp jog ijn krq bIq ]nhI qidp qau Dir gey cIq ]mun mn Anyk gun gn mhwn ]bhu kSt krq nhI Drq iDAwn ]86]
transliteration: Kaikalap Jog Jeen Karat Beet|| Nahitadip Tau Dhar(i) Gad Cheet|| Mounndman Anek Goun Gad Mahaan|| Bahu Kashat Karat Nahidharat Dhiaan||86||
translation: Even those who practiced Yoga for various Kalpas (ages) ccouldnot please His mind; many sags and virtuous people remember Him by the performance of many agonizing austerities, but that Lord does not even think of them.86.

gurmukhi: ijh eyk rUp ik`ny Anyk ]AMqih smyX Pun Bey eyk ]keI kot jMq jIvn aupwie ]iPr AMq lyq Awpih imlwie ]87]
transliteration: Jih Ek Roop Kinne Anek|| Antab(i) Sameya Phoun Bhae Ek || Kaikot Jant Oupaae|| Phir Ant Let Aapah(i) Milaae||87||
translation: He is the only One, and creates many and ultimately merges the many created forms in His oneness; He is the life-force of millions of beings and ultimately He merges all within Him.87.

gurmukhi: ijh jgq jIv sB pry Srn ]mun mn Anyk ijh jpq crn ]keI klp bIq iqhN krq iDAwn ]kwhU n dyiK iqh ib`idmwn ]88]
transliteration: Jih Jagad Jeev Sabh Dare Sharan|| Mounndman Anek Jih Japat Cahran|| Kaikalap Beet Tihan Karat Dhiaan|| Kaahoo Na Dekh(i) Tih Biddimaan||88||
translation: All the beings of the world are under His shelter and many sages meditate on His feet; that all-pervading Lord does not even scan those who mediate on Him fore many kalpas (ages).88.

gurmukhi: AwBw AnMq mihmw Apwr ]mun mn mhwn Aiq hI audwr ]AwiC`j qyj sUrqÍ Apwr ]nhI skq bu`D kir kY ibcwr ]89]
transliteration: Aabhaa Anant Mahimaa Apaar|| Mounndman Mahaan At(i) Hiudaar|| Aachhijj Tej Soortva Apaar|| Nahisakat Buddh Kar(i) Kai Bichaar||89||
translation: His Greatness and Glory are infinite; He is the Greatest amongst the sages and is extremely Generous; His effulgence is eternal and form Most Beautiful; the human intellect cannot reflect on Him.89.

gurmukhi: ijh Awid AMiq eykih srUp ]soBw ABMg mihmw AnUp ]ijh kIn joq au`doq srb ]ijh hqXo srb grbIn grb ]90]
transliteration: Jih Aadh Ant(i) Ekah(i) Daroop|| Sobhaa Abhaaag Mahimaa Anoop|| Jih Keen Jot Uddot Sarab|| Jih Hatyo Sarab Gadbeen Gadab||90||
translation: He, the Lord of Unique Greatness and Glory, remains the same in the beginning and at the end; He, who has instilled His Light in all the beings, He has also smashed the pride of the egoists.90.

gurmukhi: ijh grbvMq eykY n rwK ]iPr kho bYx nhI bYx BwK ]iek bwr mwr mwrXon S`qR ]iek bwr fwr fwirEn AqR ]91]
transliteration: Jih Gadabcant Ekai Na Raakh|| Phir Saho Bain Nahibain Bhaakh|| Ik Baar Maar Mdaryo Shattra|| Ik Baat Daar Daarion Atra||91||
translation: He, who has not left untouched even one egoist, He cannot be described in words; He kills the enemy with a single blow.91.

gurmukhi: syvk Qwip nhI dUr kIn ]liK BeI BUl muiK ibhs dIn ]ijh ghI bwih ikMno inbwh ]qiRXw eyk bXwh nhI kIn bXwh ]92]
transliteration: Sevak Thaap(i) Nahidoor Keen|| Lakh(i) Bhaibhool Moukh(i) Bihas Seen|| Jih Gadibaah(i) Kinno Nibaah|| Triyaa Ek Byaah Nahikeen Byaah||92||
translation: He never keep His devotees away from Him and just smiles even on his erratic doings; he, who comes under His Grace, his objectives are fulfilled by Him ultimately; through He has not married, even then maya is His spouse.92.

gurmukhi: rIJMq kot nhI kSt kIn ]sIJMq eyk hI nwm lIn ]An kpt rUp AnBO pRkwS ]KVgn spMin insidn inrws ]93]
transliteration: Reejhant Kot Nahikasht Keen|| Seejhant Ek Hinaam Leen|| An Kapat Roop Anbhau Prakaadh|| Khadgoun Sapann(i) Nisdin Niraas||93||
translation: Millions are getting pleased with Him and some are getting pleased only by remembering His name; He is devoid of deceit and is the manifestation o of cognition; He is Omnipotent and ever remains without desires.93.

gurmukhi: prmM piv`qR pUrx purwn ]mihmw ABMg soBw inDwn ]pwvn pRis`D prmM punIq ]Awjwn bwih AnBY AjIq ]94]
transliteration: Paramannd Pavittra Pooran Puraan|| Mahimaa Abhan Sobhaa Nidhaan|| Paavan Prasiddh Paramannd Pouneet|| Aajaan Baah(i) Anbhai Ajeet||94||
translation: He is Immaculate, Perfect, Store of Eternal Glory, Indestructible, Praiseworthy, Holy Illustrious, Omnipotent, Fearless and Unconquerable.94.
